attributes.action: use his power to change the banking laws
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
the current recession has in the main been caused by the banks and we the tax payer have had to bail them out so whilst using tax payers and voters money to help the banks now would be time to change the rules 

1)abide by the new rules or get no support from the government
2)banks can charge no more than 1.5% above the bank of england base rate on all loans 
3)no fees to be charged other
 than interest for going overdrawn (this can be charged at 5.5% above bank of england base rate )
4 all fees and penalties charged on current accounts to be outlawed and all penalties charged to accounts over the last six years to be repaided to account holders including interest at 1% above base 
5)any bank offering a credit card must not do so to anyone under the age of 25 
6)all banks must put 1.5% of there post tax profits into a government fund to the setting up of a credit union in every town and city in the uk
